p: The intraplantar injection of formalin 2% produced a biphasic pain-related behavior. Effects of normal saline and vehicle (Tween-80, 0.5%) on licking and biting time of the injected paw in male rats are presented in Figure 1. No significant differences were observed on the first phase of pain in the control (72.16±6.39 s) and Tween-80 (0.5%) (66.50±5.02 s) groups (P>0.05). In addition, no significant differences were observed on the second phase of pain in the control (208.50±15.21 s) and Tween-80 (0.5%) (196.66±14.43 s) groups (P>0.05) ( Figure 1). Therefore, the data obtained from the experimental groups were compared with vehicle treated group.
